item.title: Testing
item.description: Go’s standard library contains a testing package, which provides support for automated testing of Go packages. You define test routines and use the built-in go test command to run them. The go tool also provides commands for benchmarking and code coverage.

item.title: Testing Basics
item.description: Let’s say we have an exported function called Factorial in math.go package math // Factorial - Get the factorial of a positive integer func Factorial(n int) uint64 { if n < 2 { return 1 } return uint64(n) * Factorial(n-1) } We can write a unit test for it in the same package (i.e. same directory) without importing it.
